instruction: Based on the findings of the MSCI and Burgiss collaboration, please provide a comparison of the carbon intensities of expansion-capital funds and distressed-debt funds.
output: Expansion-capital and venture-capital funds exhibited the lowest average carbon intensities, while distressed-debt funds showed exceptionally high levels of carbon intensity. This suggests that expansion-capital and venture-capital funds may have a smaller carbon footprint compared to distressed-debt funds.
